cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest toward the Lesser Antilles, then expected to pass near or just south of the U.S. Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or south of Puerto Rico (closest coastal encounter, not a direct landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Barbados, Martinique, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy, Saba, St. Eustatius, and St. Maarten
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles, U.S. Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Strong gusty winds up to 35–45 mph possible Monday as Beryl’s remnants pass south of the island
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the north-facing San Juan coast; only minor wave run-up and hazardous surf
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches of rain with localized heavier pockets could lead to minor flooding in low-lying and urban areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions for harbor and pilot operations
